text:
Course: Foundation Degree Healthcare Assistant Practitioner
Course Code: FD-HAP-25/26
Level: L4/L5
Duration: 2 years (Full Time or Part Time)
Department: Education, Health and Law
Sub-Department: Health

Course Description:
This programme is designed to develop the skills and attributes needed for the role of the Healthcare Assistant Practitioner. Assistant Practitioners work as part of the wider health and social care team and have direct contact with patients, service users or clients providing high quality and compassionate care. Assistant Practitioners work at a level above that of Healthcare Support Workers and have a more in-depth understanding about factors that influence health and ill-health (e.g., anatomy and physiology). The programme will enable students to obtain the core skills, knowledge and values/behaviours to become an Assistant Practitioner.

Module: Academic Research and Study Skills
Module Code: W_HTH4C042R-2025.26
Module Tutor: Shelley Sanderson
Credits: 20
Year: 1
Semester: 1

Learning Outcomes:
Learning outcomes\nOn completion of this module students will be able to:\nKnowledge and Understanding: LO1 Describe and explain key theories of learning and development. (K1)\nCognitive and Intellectual Skills: LO2 Discuss the relevance of learning theories to your role when working in healthcare. (C2)\nKey Transferable Skills: LO3 Reflect on the importance of effective communication to share complex information in a professional environment (T1)

Module Description:
Module Descriptor: The module will provide students with the underpinning skills, theories and knowledge required for undergraduate study. This will also be transferable to their professional practice and provide a framework for their academic progress. This module aims to;\n● Develop academic study skills including research and referencing\n● Provide subject specific skills to enable them to succeed in their studies and the professional environment.

Assessment: Essay that addresses relevant learning theories within the Assistant Practitioner Role (1800 words) (60%)
Module: Academic Research and Study Skills
Module Code: W_HTH4C042R-2025.26
Academic Year: 1
Unit Assessor: Shelley Sanderson
Submission Location: Electronic Via Turnitin
Deadline: 14th November 2025
Submission Format: [Turnitin/Physical/Face-to-Face]

Learning Outcomes:
LO 1, 2

Assessment Brief:
Task 1 - Essay (60%) – Learning Outcomes 1 & 2 (1800 words)\nTo demonstrate your achievement of the learning outcomes for this module you will write an essay that includes the following;\n● A description of the key learning theories explored in class e.g. learning styles,\nmultiple intelligence. Explain how these theories can affect your own style of learning and your work in the hospital or community\nsetting.\n● Ensure your essay follows the academic conventions of the level of the course.

Assessment: 10 minute electronic presentation using a reflective model which explains the essential communication skills required within the professional environment. (40%)
Module: Academic Research and Study Skills
Module Code: W_HTH4C042R-2025.26
Academic Year: 1
Unit Assessor: Shelley Sanderson
Submission Location: Electronic Via Turnitin
Deadline: 9th January 2026
Submission Format: [Turnitin/Physical/Face-to-Face]

Learning Outcomes:
LO 3

Assessment Brief:
Task 2 - Electronic Presentation including Q&A (40%) Learning Outcomes 3 (10 minutes)\nCreate and present an electronic presentation to a small group of your peers which demonstrates reflections on your own\npractice.\nFocus on communication skills in the workplace, written and verbal, and to individuals and groups.
